Organ donation is governed by 3 major ethical principles enshrined in the French Bioethics Act:

*presumed consent'';''''
*free donation'';''''
*anonymity between donor and recipient'''.''''

question.title: What are the three main ethical principles governing organ donation in France?

option_a.title: Presumed consent and free donation
option_a.description: Two principles that are often mentioned together

option_b.title: Anonymity and presumed consent
option_b.description: A principle that is often confused with presumed consent

option_c.title: Free donation and anonymity
option_c.description: A principle that is often associated with altruistic donations

option_d.title: Consent, gratuity, and anonymity
option_d.description: The three main principles enshrined in the French Bioethics Act
